title: Baby fights for life after being 'beaten by evil mum who left him to go on date'
text:

A mother allegedly battered her newborn son before leaving him barely breathing to go on a date.

One-month-old Mykyta was found in his cot covered in bruises with a blocked bloodied nose and soiled clothes.

He was taken to a local hospital in the city of Rivne, Ukraine, where doctors said they had never seen a child beaten so badly.

His mother has now been accused of abusing the child before leaving him in pain and alone.

The mum and son lived in a shared social hostel, according to local reports.

Witnesses say one of the neighbours in the hostel who discovered the boy fainted after seeing his horrific condition.

Neighbours, who knew that Mykyta was alone in his room, started worrying and decided to check on him.

(Image: Credit: 1+1)

Tetiana Prymak, a woman living next door said to local media: ''When we entered the room we saw Mykyta in his crib.

''His right eye was black. His nose was blocked with baked blood and he was barely breathing.

''We started changing his clothes and saw black bruises all over his body. One woman who was in the room fainted after seeing all this.''

The neighbours called an ambulance and the police.

Mykyta was rushed to intensive care where doctors are still battling for his life. Medics assume the child has skull fractures but they cannot examine him because of his grave condition.

Mykhailo Kulik, the head of the intensive care unit of Rivne Regional Children's Hospital said: ''The boy is in a serious life-threatening condition. We suspect that his skull is fractured but we cannot examine it now.

(Image: Credit: 1+1)

(Image: Credit: 1+1)

''I have never seen a baby in such a terribly neglected state. I think his mother has never changed his clothes nor used diapers. His skin is in awful condition.''

After the mother arrived home, she was taken to a police department for interrogation.

Police spokesman Anton Kruk said: ''The mother said that she was stressed out because of the baby’s constant crying. She left the baby home alone and went on a date.''

Police launched a criminal case for battery and failure to fulfil parental duties against the mother.

Social service psychologist Yulia Tkachenko could not help crying after seeing the child and having a conversation with his mother.

She said: "There are no doubts that the baby was brutally beaten up. The mother said that 'she did not touch Mykyta and that his injuries were caused by cold draft'."

(Image: Credit: 1+1)

(Image: Credit: 1+1)

Mykyta's father, a man of 27 years, is reportedly not interested in the fate of the boy, local media report.

Igor Novosad, the head of the social hostel who knows the family said: ''The mother has an older son. She gave him birth at 16 and he is three years old now. The child was taken from her to a rehabilitation centre because of domestic abuse.''

Reports say both children are fathered by different men.

Social services are collecting documents and going to sue the mother.

Andriy Mishchenia, the head of Rivne Child Protection Service said: ''The mother is going to be deprived of parental rights. The baby boy will be taken away from her and placed into an orphanage.''

The mother faces up to five years in prison if found guilty, police said.
